inn1.comm: good length at 132kph, outside off, left alone and goes gently through to Buttler
a little shorter this time, Finch happy to leave it alone early on
another one left alone as he resists an early dart
nice delivery, a touch fuller and close to off stump, hint of shape away as Finch leaves alone
first attempt at some aggression, it was short from Broad and Finch aim to pull through midwicket but was beaten by a lack of bounce
hanging it outside off and the match starts with a maiden
down the leg side first ball, it swung but started on the wrong line
gets it straighter, but still around leg stump and it takes Marsh's thigh pad behind square
full outside off, Finch content to watch them go past off stump
dropped England miss their first opportunity, Finch tempting into a flashing drive at a full delivery and the thick flew high, but very catchable, to Cook at first slip. Couldn't hold it to his right
good delivery, on off stump and it takes the outside edge down to third man but was pretty well controlled by Marsh
full outside off, driven very crisply to cover
left alone outside off...Jordan should have been rewarded in that over
full on off stump, 137kph, a cross-seam delivery and Marsh defends to the covers
short of a length on middle and leg, tucked off his pads down to long leg
lovely stroke, the best one of the early stages of this match as he leans into a cover drive...it wasn't a full half volley, but the pitch is so good you can drive through the line
dropped! And another. England having a shocker. Bopara this time at cover. Finch drives again, not in control this time, and it's basically a dolly which is shelled
straight down the ground, in the air but nowhere near a fielder as it goes straight of mid-on
short of a length on off stump, he's onto the back foot and defends
full at off stump, 137kph, onto the front foot and defends square to cover
comes forward again, pushed up to mid-off
swings down the leg side, decent pace at 140kph but started on the wrong line
big shout for lbw, full and swinging into Marsh's pads as he flicks across the line...perhaps an inside edge
a bit straight from Jordan but it clips the pads to the leg side
good delivery, full with some swing, but there's another fumble in the field, this time at mid-off as Marsh pushed it fairly gently towards Bresnan
keeps his drive along the ground this time as he picks out mid-off
short of a length, defends with an open face to backward point
gets across on off stump, 134kph, defended back to the bowler
guides this down to third man, was quite tight to his body and a similar delivery to the one he fell to in Perth but not as much bounce here

gone this time! Finch can't make the most of his two lives. Excellent delivery from Broad, on a full length and nips back at Finch who is caught on the back foot and loses his off stump as he tries to get his bat down. Just checking the no-ball, but something was ground behind the line
gets across on off stump to a length delivery and defends to midwicket
full outside off stump, Watson makes himself get forward and his defensive shot runs to the on side
tight to off stump, holds its line as Marsh judges well and leaves
this one is fuller and on off stump, Marsh is forward and driving but the bat turns in his hands and the ball squirts to square leg
defended from off stump to mid-on...very few freebies from England so far today (with the ball, at least)
this is a tad too full, allows Marsh to lean into a cover drive which bisects mid-off and cover...Bresnan makes a hard chase, but then misses his flick back at the rope! Oops.
now he over compensates, goes too short and Marsh latches on with a powerful cut through point
full again, forward it a drive which goes quickly back to Jordan in his followthrough

huge appeal for lbw! Playing across a full delivery on off stump. Looked very tight. And Cook reviews. Did it get outside the line? Blimey, this is close. No inside edge. Only if it's clipping leg will he be saved. And it is! Only clipping leg. Watson survives. That wasn't a poor review from England, but that's all they have

it doesn't matter though! He edges his next ball. Length delivery outside off, a touch wide, Watson lunges into a drive on the up and only sends the nick to Buttler. Pretty poor from Watson. Two innings on this series and two ducks.
starts full at off stump, stays on the crease and defends
full outside off, hint of shape back into Clarke who gets onto off stump and covers up
drags it shorter outside off, Clarke drives square but can't beat point
back of a length outside off, defended to cover. An excellent over from Broad. Wicket maiden.
on the pads, Marsh flicks across the line and gets a thick inside edge backward of square leg
full on off stump, runs off an open face backward of point and Morgan can't prevent the single
back of a length, defended with a straight bat
good line, tight on off stump, defended to mid-off
keeps him in defence with another ball on off stump, played out to cover
punched off the back foot to cover, a consistent string of deliveries to keep Clarke on nought
defends a full delivery with a slightly open face, Bell runs around from second slip to field
touch shorter, defended to the leg side
tucked to midwicket from short of a length
played off the back foot into the off side
gets this one into a gap on the leg side between square leg and mid-on
short of a length, angled into the pads just a fraction and worked out to square leg
full at off stump, driven firmly to a straight mid-on
angled down the leg side, clips the pad through to Buttler so it saves a wide
defended into the leg side, almost dead-batted and the ball goes nowhere so the fielders inside the ring can't stop the single
tight run! Defended off the back foot to mid-off, Jordan the fielder and he's a bit slow getting to the ball and releasing it. Opts to throw over arm, he hits direct but has taken too long
left alone outside off, shaping back into Clarke
worked off the stumps wide of midwicket
tucked off the pads out to deep square-leg
full outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
a nice piece of timing through the leg side as he flicks a straight delivery in front of square...nearly reaches the short boundary
touch fuller on middle and off, Marsh closes the face and finds a gap at square leg
full outside off, a slightly flat-footed drive by Clarke but safe enough
short ball outside off stump, Clarke doesn't have to do much more than just nod his head out of the way
defended to backward point
fuller delivery, driven towards mid-off and it's the lack of timing that gives him time for a comfortable single
defended with soft hands square into the off side but Morgan is quickly in from point
neatly worked off the stumps and bisects long leg and deep square
too straight and tucked off his hip down to long leg
back of a length, taken from off stump into midwicket...good rotation of the strike, but only three boundaries so far
round the wicket, driven out to deep cover
stays round the wicket, Clarke uses his feet then tucks him off the stumps through square leg
down the pitch and pushes up to long-on
pushed into the on side and Tredwell gets across
more footwork down the pitch but picks out square leg this time
touch shorter, Clarke rocks back and drives to cover
full on middle and off, defended and Bresnan skips across from his followthrough to field
tries to work a straight delivery into midwicket but doesn't get it much further than the cut strip
more power in this shot, a bottom-handed whip to a full delivery but it goes straight to midwicket
outside off, runs it down to third man
adjusts well to the right hander, on off stump, defended down into the pitch and it bounces back towards the keeper

all over for Clarke! The pressure brings another breakthrough. Clarke tried to heave a length ball through the leg side, it was a pretty ugly shot and takes a bottom edge into off stump which ends up out of the ground
full from round the wicket, driven down the ground
uses his feet and gets off the mark to long-on
full at off stump, opens the face and finds point
that's an excellent shot, whips it from off stump wide of mid-on for a rare boundary
mid-on has gone deep so this time it's an easy single down the ground
flicked off the stumps to square leg
full and straying a touch on the pads as he whips it through to deep square leg
nudges forward as he meets this fullish ball on off stump with a push into the covers.
safely behind that length ball, but he was looking to clip it through the midwicket region for a single, but none is available
nicely behind this again as Bresnan plugs away just outside off
good length ball, just outside off as Bailey prods forward and defends
this time the fuller ball slides down leg and I think it went off the pads as he looked to glance it down.
closed the face too early there, but the leading edge doesn't carry to the bowler
again, looking to nudge it through midwicket and he ends up edging it towards the vacant silly point region
more circumspect this time as he defends the fullish offspinner off the front foot
moves well across his off stump and ramps it behind to fine leg for a single. Almost premeditated that to fight the line Tredwell is bowling
chips down the track and finds long-off for complete an easy single
seen him advance again as he shortened the length. Bailey has to settle for no runs as he finds midwicket with a clip
really tight bowling from Bresnan, keeps it just short of a good length on and around off stump as Marsh blocks to the covers
goes back and plays with soft hands as he dabs it into the off side and before cover can come swooping in on the ball, the batsman run through for the single
prods forward to meet the good length ball with a defensive bat.
a thickish outside edge carries the length ball on off stump to deep third man. Bailey did open the face there as he played from the crease
and there's a bit of variation. 118 kph-slower ball as Marsh tucks off of the front foot into midwicket and collects a single
followed by the short ball, not rising enough to trouble Bailey though as he pulls it down and has timed it well enough. There is protection at deep midwicket though.
oh, Buttler saw and and was rushing down leg to try and block the lap-sweep from Bailey. But he gets good enough bat to get the ball above the keeper
flighted on off stump as he reaches the pitch and drives into the covers
has a little nip down the track and having reached to the pitch, turns it just wide of mid-on. A little fumble allows the batsmen to sneak a single
Bailey advances now but with the length being shortened again, he can only nudge it to the leg side
again Buttler anticipates the sweep from Bailey and tries to keep it to none, but the ball is lobbed over the keeper's outstretched arms
rocks back and makes room outside leg to cut the ball through point
just back of a length outside off as Marsh gets in line and blocks
fuller on off stump as he draws Marsh forward and limits him to a defensive push down the pitch
length ball on off as this time Marsh chooses to play off the back foot. Opens the face and guides it to point

and he's done it! Marsh has clipped it straight to short midwicket! He's been setting a foundation, but that should might not have been part of the plan. Innocuous length ball on the pads and it was there to be whipped away through the leg side. Perhaps it might have come a little slower off the pitch, perhaps his timing was just shot, but the ball had nothing on it as it went just a little to the left of Cook, who grabbed hold quite comfortably
solidly behind the first one, which was just short of a good length on middle and off
and he's off and running, exploiting a length ball on the pads and clipping it away to deep square leg.
this one had very little though. 110 kph slower ball as he gets right forward and blocks
full and sliding down leg as Maxwell leans forward and glances it down to long leg rather nicely.
short cover does well there, cutting across to his right and diving to keep that elegant drive, hit on the up from Maxwell. Jordan's keeping it nice and full

darts in off the pitch and Jordan likes it. But I suspect it might have missed leg. Hit on the knee-roll too as Maxwell is caught on the crease. Was hurrying to flick it away but he wasn't quick enough to combat the movement
fullish on off and it moves into him again, but this time Maxwell manages to squirt it away through square leg
length ball, hitting the bat rather heavily as Bailey pulls off the bottom hand and places the ball into the midwicket region
loses his radar this time as he offers up a full toss outside off. Bailey fails to capitalise as he goes forward and smacks it straight to point
very full outside off again, just inside the wide line as Maxwell looks to chop it to third man, but doesn't connect
full on the stumps as he drives quite nicely. Stokes gets a finger on it and the ball deflects onto the stumps as there is a bit of an appeal, but Bailey had plonked his bat inside
full and angling in on the pads as he clips it away through square leg
full and just outside off as he drives down the ground
aha, we have a boundary. The first since seven overs as Bailey clips a full delivery angled in at him straight of deep midwicket
shortish and on the hips as he works it away towards fine leg
fullish and targeting the stumps but Bailey is equal to the challenge
no movement of the feet there as Jordan generates some inward movement off a good length. Thick inside edge helps him get off strike as the ball wanders away through square leg
length ball on the stumps as he looks to whip it away, but can't get bat to ball
pounds in on a good length as Maxwell comes forward to defend
opens the face and chops this back of a length ball outside off just to the right of the keeper
that gap just in front of square leg is proving quite useful as this short of a good length delivery is tucked away for another single

very tight single but Bailey makes it, courtesy the throw being deflected off his bat as he was grounding it. He'd missed the flick and Maxwell calls him through. Stokes gets to the ball quickly but can't strike the stumps direct
fullish on middle and off as he defends off the front foot
strays down the pads as he looks to whip it away, but has to settle for a leg bye to long leg
width offered outside off stump, but it was nice and full again as Bailey sinks low and meets it with an open face
goes short this time and the line was right on middle too, but Maxwell covers it well as he goes ball and pulls it down to fine leg for a single
length outside off as he punches it off the front foot to deep point with little fuss
very clever. It had enough width for Bailey to nudge forward and open the face. Got it fine enough to beat deep third man for another boundary.
this time he can't get it as fine and backward point keeps it to a single
went a touch wide of the crease that time as he keeps it full and on off stump. Maxwell drives back to the bowler
pushed to long-on as he meets the length ball with a good straight bat
ducks in a touch off the pitch, which makes Bailey pull out a short-armed jab to midwicket
looks to dab the back of a length ball behind point, but can't place it well enough
draws him forward and Maxwell meets the full length ball outside off with a straight bat. Can't get it far enough away from the bowler though
tries a late cut, but there wasn't enough width there. Good delivery from Stokes, just short of a good length and around fifth stump
full and just wide enough outside off for him to lean forward and play a solid cover drive
stifled appeal as this is full and pushed into the pads of Maxwell. Was always going down leg
fullish on off stump as he comes forward to block
worked away towards the square leg region as he rides the angle of this full length ball coming in at him
length ball on the stumps, Bailey is content to keep it out.
shortish, but it didn't rise high enough which foiled that pull stroke. The ball lobs off the thigh and down to the keeper
turns the full length ball on the pads to square leg
full and just outside off as he drives, but can't time it well enough
nudged away to deep midwicket off the front foot as this was full and sneaking down leg
length on off stump as he keeps to his crease and defends
opens the face to run the fullish ball outside off down to third man
head right over this one kept on a good length on off stump as he defends off the front foot
third man has more work as Maxwell guides the back of a length ball away from off stump
punished and how! That brings up the hundred for Australia as Bailey pounces onto the width on offer. Rocks back and cuts it behind point with considerable authority
compensates as he tightens his line and in the process strays into the pads as he tucks it to long leg for a couple
the run-rate's definitely on an upswing now. strays on the pads with a full length ball and Maxwell flicks it to the leg of short fine leg and has timed it quite well
on the stumps again as this is punched to long-on for a single
fullish on middle as he pushes down to long-on off the front foot
fullish and just outside off as Maxwell presses forward and steers it just behind point for a single.
touch fuller and he ensures the line is well outside off as Bailey guides it away to deep point
full and seeking off stump but Maxwell moves confidently onto his front foot and drives to deep cover
searches for the blockhole and he finds it. Maxwell can do little more than stop the ball from crashing into the stumps

Stokes does it again! Maxwell nicks off! He was doing reasonably well, especially with those drives through cover and dabs to third man, but this time he can't get good enough bat. It was fullish and he wanted to run it to third man again, but only manages a healthy edge through to the keeper.
full and just outside off as he drives towards mid-off
off the mark with a flick down to deep midwicket as this was on a length and on leg stump
fullish and on the stumps as he is able to keep it out with a push to mid-on
ventures fuller and just outside off as he drives off the back foot. Mid-on is in play again and keeps it to none
bit shortish and outside off as he goes back and punches through to deep cover
charges him and reaches to the pitch, but still plays with the turn. Clipped to deep midwicket and he runs with the shot for a single
pushed through on middle and leg as Wade can only defend off the back foot
another venture down the track but the new batsman can't find his timing or placement. Tredwell is safely behind it
tossed up and angled into the pads as he turns it behind square leg for a single
silly misfield means the over ends with a single to long-on. He reached forward and dabbed it straight of midwicket, and the fielder dived over the ball
fullish and on off stump as he pushes to mid-off. Nice stride forward from Bailey
easily clipped off the pads as this was on a length and targeting leg stump. Deep square leg keeps it to one
strides forward and drives through the line of the full length ball outside off, but cannot get it past mid-off
fullish on middle, and he plonks the front foot towards the off side and nudges it towards the midwicket region and picks up a single
Bailey hustles and he gets through for a couple after flicking this length ball off the pads to fine leg

dangerous, but effective. Full toss outside off and Bailey might have ended up looking rather silly had mid-on managed to get his hands to that. But the chip had enough power on it to beat his dive and run away for four
moves deep in his crease and punches the length ball into the covers
chips down the track and places the tossed up ball on leg stump square of fine leg to pick up a single.
tossed up and it goes on with the arm with very little spin. Wade ventures down the track and gets an inside edge onto pad
another little dance down the wicket but he can hit the flighted ball on middle only as far as the bowler
steers this full ball through the covers for a single
touch short just outside off as he goes back to cut, but gets a thick inside edge
length on and around off stump as he blocks from the crease with an open face
walks at him and moves outside off stump and dabs it into the midwicket region
more work for midwicket as Bailey works the length ball
takes advantage of Bresnan straying in line. Picks the ball off his hips and flicks it fine to long leg.
goes for the hook, but has not got hold of it at all. Good short ball from Bresnan, possibly catching Wade off guard. But it lands safely despite deep square leg running in
touch short and the bit of width allows Bailey to cut the ball and time it well enough to make deep third man's job quite difficult. But he slides and pulls the ball back to keep it to three
uses the feet and drives down to long-on
Wade leans out to defend to the off side
drives harder to cover but can't find the gap
nudged away edgily behind point for a quick single
Tredwell is around the wicket to Bailey, who pushes the ball to off
gets one on the legs and whips it away to deep square leg
clipped away through midwicket for a single
Wade works this from on off stump to midwicket but can't find the gap
walks across the stumps and tries to create something but all he manages is a little inside edge onto the body for a quick single to off
Bailey brings up his half-century with a late cut down to third man
nudged away to the off side
a touch shorter now and Wade pulls through the leg side for a single
worked away off the pads for a run down to fine leg
good line just outside off and Bailey can't beat point
on the pads and Bailey clips another one through leg
Wade again nudges into the leg side and can't find a run
walks across and down the pitch and whips it away to fine leg and this is sharp running as Wade hurries back for two
on the pads but Wade doesn't get bat on ball, settles for a leg bye instead
on the back foot now, Wade crunches it back towards Bresnan
Wade goes the big pull here as he gets something a touch short but he can't get bat on ball - much like in Perth, he's looking pretty scratchy
nudged away to the off side
tries to create something again by walking across his stumps but Bresnan follows him, and Wade can only open the face and run this down to third man
Bailey waits on a late cut and picks up one to third man

this time Wade gets his pull away, and he's placed it well enough that it bounces over the boundary for four. There was a man at deep midwicket but this went squarer and Wade will be relieved to have his first boundary on the board
full face of the bat from Bailey as he pushes to off
down leg side now and the Australians pick up a bonus run
Broad angles this in to the pads and with a man at deep midwicket Bailey's flick is just for a single
again Wade goes for it when he gets a bouncer but doesn't middle this, has to settle for a single to deep fine leg
defended solidly back down the pitch
on the back foot now, Bailey defends
good line just outside off draws a thick edge as Bailey drives hard at this, it turns into a single to third man
angled in to Bailey's off stump, he defends to leg
push and run now as Bailey takes off for a quick single to mid-on
Wade nudges out towards cover point and can't find a run

lbw shout here from Jordan and this didn't look too bad, maybe just pitching a touch outside leg? The umpire wasn't really interested. He was struck in line but possibly height an issue too. Pretty close shout, but England don't have a review left
down leg and clips the pad on the way through
Bailey gets a little width but his drive can't beat cover
Stokes gives Wade something short and wide to start with and Wade pounces on it - he has thrown everything at a cut and to the short square boundaries at this ground that was always going to be four
now Wade mistimes a little but gets a single to cover
Bailey waits and plays this very late, steers a single down to third man
Wade walks down the pitch and works one out to deep midwicket along the ground

Bailey tries to lift the scoring rate here and he's perished doing it, he's planted the front foot and tried to crunch Stokes straight down the ground but drags it towards mid-on instead, and Stuart Broad takes a good catch.
Faulkner defends his first ball back towards the bowler
Jordan attacks the middle and leg line, Wade works to mid-on
Wade clips this off his hips and some very sharp running again turns it into two
again Wade gets one on the pads and can't find the gap at midwicket
walks across the stumps and tries to steer this behind midwicket but just finds the fielder again
shorter now and Wade pulls a single out to deep midwicket
Faulkner leans out to defend and gets off the mark with a thick inside edge away behind square
horrible ball to start from Broad, just a rank delivery way down leg and Faulker manages to get bat on ball, which was all he had to do to tickle this away for a boundary to fine leg
pushed out through point for another single
Wade defensively pushes away to off
tries to cut hard now but this ball was perhaps just a touch too straight to cut, it beats the bat through to Buttler

oh, Wade has been bowled behind his legs! Wade has been walking across his stumps quite often in this innings, this time he doesn't get bat on Ball and Broad pitches it just outside leg and it goes on with the angle to take the leg stump
pushed away to mid-off
fullish from Stokes and Faulkner drives to mid-off
steered away towards point off the face of the gap
Stokes tries for the yorker but Faulkner is good enough to glance this fine
wide down leg side now gives Australia a bonus run
fullish and straightish, Coulter-Nile pushes it away to cover
again Stokes goes full, and Coulter-Nile gets off the mark with a run down to third man
Faulkner leans outside off to defend
good line outside off and it's driven hard to cover

Coulter-Nile goes aerial now, he's flicked this uppishly off his pads and Stokes is at deep midwicket, he runs in and this ball only just falls short of the diving Stokes. Nearly a catch - very nearly a catch.
bouncer this time and Faulkner ducks underneath it
angled in to the pads and Faulkner just picks up a single through square leg
cut hard into the turf and away to deep point for one more
soft hands from Faulkner as he nudges this away for a quick single to midwicket
banged in short of a length and Faulkner just defends
closes the face and works this through square leg for another single
jams down on a clunky cover drive that finds the sweeper in the deep
Stokes goes for the yorker and Faulkner turns it into a low full toss that he steers wide of mid-on
half a shout for lbw from Stokes as Coulter-Nile tries to work this through leg - there were two noises but it was front pad onto back pad - maybe sliding down leg but not a bad shout
defended away to the off side
angled down onto the pads and Coulter-Nile tries to go aerial again but just tickles it off the pad to fine leg
Faulkner gets on away to the boundary now, he's really opened up and gone for a slog through cow corner - it has only just managed to beat the man at wide midwicket in the circle
fuller and wide of off, Faulkner can only nudge a single
Coulter-Nile has decided he too will go after Bresnan, and he's planted the foot and launched a drive over wide mid-off, well struck and this bounces away to the boundary
more width and this time he crunches it through point
Faulkner drives hard to mid-off and takes a single to keep the strike
Faulkner backs away and Jordan follows him, this ball is clipped away through square leg to bring up the 200 for Australia
Coulter-Nile tries to hoick this over leg but another one just dribbles off the leg for a leg bye
good yorker length ball that Faulkner clips away through midwicket and they want two but the fielding is sharp enough to prevent it
again a good yorker from Jordan, all Coulter-Nile can do is clip it away through square leg
this time the yorker is just not quite the right length, a half-volley that Faulkner lifts over wide midwicket but the man running around on the boundary cuts it off
another couple of runs for Faulkner as he crunches a low full toss back past Jordan
half a chance here for Bresnan, a dropped chance but an incredibly tough one as Coulter-Nile drives it hard back towards the bowler's left - he thrusts the hand out and it doesn't stick
wide of off now and crunched away towards point
uppishly driven through cover point now and Bell in the deep collects
well wide of off and it's a low full toss, Faulkner can only managed to pick up two over extra cover

run-out chance here as Bresnan goes full and Faulkner's little inside edge is collected by Buttler, whose underarm throw hits the stumps. Coulter-Nile has slid the bat in nicely though and made good ground. The umpire asks for a replay but Coulter-Nile is shown to be safe
driven back past the bowler for a single
low full toss again and it's driven back over the head of the bowler
Jordan mixes it up now with the bouncer that Faulkner perhaps wasn't expecting - the attempted hook misses

Jordan gets this one too full but it's brought him a wicket! Faulkner's eyes light up with a full toss at knee height, he's got it high out towards midwicket but hasn't got enough on it to clear the fielder, who takes a comfortable catch.

and Jordan finds himself on a hat-trick after getting this one fast and straight enough to have Coulter-Nile lbw trying to walk across and force it through leg. That looked pretty plumb at first glance.
no hat-trick for Jordan as Doherty gets one just outside off and crunches it through point for a single
McKay winds up for a slog but this is collected at mid-on and they just pick up a single

inn2.comm: full and wide outside off, left alone
closer to off stump, through to the keeper
good delivery, hint of movement on a full length to find the outside edge but to goes low and wide of slip
swinging way down the leg side
back outside off, gentle pace, Cook leaves it alone
misses out on some width as he cuts to cover off the front foot
full on off stump, better delivery, defended back to the bowler
short of a length on the pads, clipped firmly to midwicket on the edge of the ring
full outside off, he also finds swing, and it bounces twice through to Wade
play and a miss as he shapes to cut a wide delivery, beaten by lack of bounce
better delivery, hints the pitch harder back of a length, shaping away from Bell as he leaves
a little fuller, left alone again
wide outside off, was there for an attacking stroke but Bell happy not to play
another leave to end a tidy, if unthreatening over
full on off stump, defended back towards mid-off
sprayed wide outside off, another extra, McKay doesn't appear in sync so far
adjusts his line, on middle and leg, worked off the pads behind square
full at off stump, Bell a good stride down the pitch and defends to short cover
first sign of aggression as Bell drives over point, the ball didn't come out of the middle but was struck with enough power to reach the rope
fuller and closer to off stump, defended to cover
close! Nearly a return catch. A full delivery, Bell shaping to play through midwicket and the toe-end rushes back towards McKay, low to his right. Finger-tip job.
short outside off, stays on the back foot and cuts behind point
another leading edge, aiming to play a length delivery through the leg side and the leading edge loops into the covers this time
left alone outside off, this one carries nicely to Wade
that's elegant from Bell, completely in control this as McKay drifts too straight and gets flicked over midwicket
back outside off, full and driven to cover
defended square to point
full outside off, just starts to come back into Cook as he leaves it alone
shuffles across the crease and works this from around leg stump through the on side
back of a length outside off, nicely timed square off the back foot but straight to point
defended to cover
delicately played by Bell, he started to come down the pitch then opened the face to run the ball to third man
full on middle and off, defended and the ball runs to square leg
touch short, driven off the back foot to cover
finds the gap this time as he waits a fraction longer and cuts behind point...third man is quite square
almost early with an on-drive again, which brings the danger of spooning a catch and this was in the air a little while towards mid-off
punched to midwicket
ah, that's lovely from Bell...a beautiful back-foot square drive which pierces the gap between point and cover. Technically perfect

from beauty to the beast! The danger of driving on this pitch, it wasn't a half volley and Bell tried to go on the up and only succeeded in spooning a catch to mid-off. Careless really from Bell, having already been given warning signs with a couple of leading edges.
left alone outside off
another one through to the keeper
down the leg side, Wade goes up for a catch as he thought he heard something but the umpire just calls a wide
corrects onto off stump, defended to cover
just short! Cook's eyes lit up at a short ball, he went back and pulled and nearly picked out Marsh at midwicket
solidly defended to mid-on
outside off, Stokes not interested in that one
guided down to third man off an open face, placed fine of the fielder so there's a second on offer
tucked away from off stump into the leg side
short delivery, goes for the pull and beaten by a lack of pace as he's through his shot early
on off stump, defended to short cover
angled into the pads, strong appeal from the bowler but that didn't look straight enough...Wade was heading down the leg side
pushed back to the bowler
tries to guide this behind square on the off side but was too close to his body and was beaten on the top edge
on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
picks out midwicket! Australia getting an early foothold. A short ball, holds in the surface and Stokes is early into his pull then can't keep the ball down. Like Bell, a poor stroke on this surface.
full on off stump, behind the line and defended
edged! But short! Nervous stroke by Root, fiddling outside off trying to guide to third man and it comes off low down the bat, falling in front of Wade
gets across outside off and whips this towards mid-on...hard work out there
back of a length on off stump, played up to mid-on
tries to use his wrists to place this into a gap, but the leg side is tightly packed
gets a fraction too straight this time and it's flicked to deep square
round the wicket, angled into the stumps, worked to square leg
tries to use his feet to come at Faulkner then pushes to cover
cut firmly down to third man
full on off stump, Root nearly falls across his shot aiming to the leg side
walking into his shot again, pushed to backward point...Root trying to disrupt the length
outside edge from a full delivery which holds its line, but it's safely down to third man
that's a beauty, seams away past Cook's outside from that length which leaves the batsman undecided about whether being forward or back
lovely stroke, McKay getting too straight and Cook times it as well as anything today through square leg...bottom hand come into play
comes forward into a punchy drive, but McKay takes the heat off it in his followthrough
latches onto a short ball, and commits to going up and over...clears midwicket. His movement around the crease helped create that scoring chance
outside off, left alone
now he opens the face and finds third man
short of a length, defended to mid-off
now he runs down to third man...one of the release shots on this pitch
angled into the pads, neatly worked out to deep square...Root sets off thinking of two but it's not on
defended to cover
round the wicket, full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
drives into the off side
dragged down short, into the pads, only costs a single into midwicket
tucked from outside off, with the turn, through square leg
tight to off stump, Root exposes his timber as he cuts to point
now he's forward and plays a straight delivery to midwicket
just over midwicket! Dropped short by Faulkner, Cook pulls firmly off the front foot and gets enough elevation to clear the man inside the ring
a low full toss, clipped along the ground this time and placed in front of square
full outside off, finds his length, gets a thick inside edge into the pads
a fraction shorter, driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
round the wicket, full outside off, defended behind point
gets forward to a full delivery, pushed it back down the pitch
taken from outside off and work to the left of midwicket...good placement
driven to backward point
gets an inside edge into his pads
wasn't very short but Root played back and cut to point
finds a gap this time out to deep cover
picks out square leg
uses his feet, comes down outside off then plays to mid-on
125kph, run down to third man
worked off leg stump out to deep midwicket
full on middle, worked just to the right of mid-on who is deep enough to allow a single
pushed firmly up to mid-off
short of a length, flicked off the back foot through square leg...smart batting from Cook
close on two accounts! Round the wicket, went to paddle a very full delivery - in fact a full toss - and it falls short of square leg and then it's a tight single
pushed up to mid-on
onto the back foot, the ball skids on a touch and hurries Root but he is able to work it through square leg
on the back foot, pushed with a straight bat up to long-on
staying on the back foot and using his wrists to flick it through square leg
worked from off stump to midwicket
starts off around the wicket and its quite short too. Root finds short fine leg with his pull though
flighted on the pads as Root goes down and sweeps to deep square leg
this time it's the reverse and he's got good wood on it. Fetched the ball from around middle and leg and beat deep point comfortably
a bit of orthodoxy now after the boundary has been taken, driven down the ground
stays around to the left-hander as Cook tucks the tossed up delivery on leg towards square leg for a single
tossed up on leg invites another good sweep shot from Root to end the over as deep midwicket runs to his right to clean up
chips down the track and pushes the flighted ball on off stump down the ground and runs with the shot. Hustles through to complete the quick single
nicely flighted on off stump as Cook reaches forward and defends
muscled away, not often you describe a stroke from Cook that way, but he got down on one knee and swept this flat ball on middle with a bit of disdain
goes back and whips the ball in front of midwicket for a single
ventures down the track, but having not reached the pitch of this length ball on middle, he resorts to defence
rocks back as this is a touch short and cuts to deep point for a single and that brings up the fifty partnership between these two
shortish ball pushed across him as Root goes deep in his crease and cuts through the covers
loads of flight from Maxwell, so much that Root is able to take it on the full and lap sweep it to short fine leg
the old faithful sweep is in display again, that's the fifth time in two overs, right? Finds short fine leg again
flatter delivery on off stump as he rocks back and cuts well in front of point
this time it comes a little slower off the pitch to ruin Root's timing. Only gets a thick edge and Root is not pleased. That was a shortish delivery too
flighted on middle and leg as he nudges it through the midwicket region for a single
dances down the track and works it away to midwicket, but can't beat the man
room offered outside off stump as Root glides forward and drives through the covers
premeditated the sweep this time and even if Doherty shortened his length, the line is sufficient to help him beat backward squar leg
went back to sneak a single to short third man, but there was none on offer
keeps it on and around off stump as he pushes into the covers
flighted on middle as he presses forward to nudge down to mid-on
lovely line just outside off and Cook allows it passage to the keeper
a bit too close for that short to work as Cook guides this short of a length ball on off stump straight to point
sways towards leg to whack this short ball with a bit of room outside off, but I think we went at it a bit too hard. Gets a thick bottom edge
full and angled across Cook as he comes forward and drives to mid-off
punched away past cover. Good balance from Cook as he picks up a single off this back of a length ball just outside off
shortish and with just enough width to lure Root into a cut, but he finds point
fullish, but Cook prefers to go back and cuts this one from off stump to deep point
vociferous appeal from Doherty as he traps Root on the back foot with a dart on leg stump, might have been sliding down
tossed up on middle as he leans forward to defend
skips down the track and presents a straight bat despite Doherty shortening his length. Single taken as the ball is hit just wide of mid-off
fires it in on leg stump and it hits Cook on the back boot as he looks to flick it away through square leg
moves forward and slices the full length ball outside off stump with an open face through point
magnificent strike, takes a solid stride forward and hits this fullish ball through the line but he cannot beat cover
full on off again as he pushes down the ground off the front foot
just a bit short and Cook is on the back foot and pulls, but it goes straight o midwicket. Slow pitch hurting the timing of the England captain
length ball angled across him as he steers it off the back foot to backward point

he's spooned it to short cover! Coulter-Nile is elated as he sends the England captain packing. It was a good length ball, but Cook was early into his drive through the covers. He tried removing the bottom hand off the bat, but that didn't help as the ball strikes the blade a little too high and Bailey dives forward to complete a good grab
fullish and pushed across him as he moves forward and dabs to third man to get off the mark straight away
tossed up on middle as he clips it to midwicket off the front foot
goes down on one knee and takes this tossed up ball on middle and laps it to long leg for a single
strides down the pitch but Doherty tries to push it wide outside off. Morgan's reach is far enough as he drills the ball to mid-on
stays back and turns the ball with soft hands just in front of square leg and they scurry through for a quick single
goes back and punches the length ball down to mid-on

length on off stump as he goes back and punches into the covers. Bailey gets a good bounce and sends in the throw. A direct hit would have had Root there, despite the full-length dive. Doherty might have thought it would break the stumps on it's own. May even have been out had he collected it
full and on middle and leg as he clips the ball through to deep square leg
fullish on off stump as he comes forward and drives down the pitch

chipped just over the top of midwicket. And though two men were running after it, the ball was pulled inside just before striking the boundary rope. Nice shot from Morgan as Coulter-Nile strayed too straight
steady line and length on off stump as Root goes back to defend
on the front foot and flicks the full length ball on middle to deep square leg for another single
"wait" was the first ball, but then Morgan sees the single on offer. Back of a length on the pads as he shuffles across and tucks it just square of midwicket
full delivery on off stump as he continues over the wicket to the left-hander. Solid forward defence from Morgan
touch too short and Morgan flays this through extra cover. Loads of power into that stroke
tossed up on middle and leg as he turns it away through midwicket
flighted on off stump as Root defends
driven to mid-off as Doherty attacks off stump with a bit of flight
drags this one short and Root is quick on the back foot as he punches through the covers
back of a length just outside off as Root stands up tall and blocks
shortish and Root is propped up nicely on the back foot as he pulls down and in front of square for a couple. Nicely placed as he bisects the two men in the deep there
uses soft hands as he dabs it into the off side and rushes down for the single, but Root sends him back. Good, accurate bowling from Watson as this was back of a length outside off
punch off the back foot to mid-off as this was shortish and outside off
fullish and on a fifth-stump line as he moves forward and drives to mid-off
works the short ball off the hips to midwicket
shortish outside off as Morgan is content with pushing down the ground
bit short and it had just enough room for Morgan go back and cut past point
full on middle as Root drives solidly to mid-on. He needs to get those in the gap somehow
just back of a good length as Root responds with a back foot defensive
length and straying onto the pads, perfect recipe for the flick through midwicket. Nelson's up
full on off stump as Morgan stride forward and drives back to the bowler
fullish on off stump draws Root forward and defend as England's required rate inches over five
just short of a good length as he pushes down to mid-off
better, works this wide of mid-on after coming down the pitch to meet the fullish ball on middle
slapped straight over the top, that's the first six of the game! Watson overpitches this time and the left-hander was waiting for it. Strides forward and unleashes a full swing of the bat
drops it down towards the point region and scurries through for a quick single. Didn't get it off the middle, but it will suffice
length ball on and around off stump, solidly pushed into the off side as short cover runs to his right and keeps it to a dot
allows this shortish ball on leg stump to come to him before glancing it down to long leg
fullish and outside off but Root can only push it back to the bowler and walks off briskly towards square leg
premeditated scoop shot and the full length ball comes off the bicep. Rushes through for a single as the ball on off runs down to third man
strays on the pads and Morgan turns it away behind square leg
length ball angled in at the stumps as he defends
length ball on off, punched into the covers
whacks it over the head of the bowler again. No danger in that shot because mid-on is in and Morgan takes full advantage of the length ball on off stump
Wade's been struck on the knee as this shortish ball outside off keeps quite low. Morgan was looking to cut it down to third man and though he got quite deep in the crease, he can't connect
strides forward this time to drive to mid-off as Watson bowls one full and outside off
fullish on off stump as Morgan leans forward and finds mid-off
plays this so late and employs really soft hands to dab the ball to third man for a single
short ball, walloped! That should bring considerable relief to Root as he rocked back and launched this over midwicket. One bounce and into the boundary
tossed up and he draws Morgan to play well away from his body, but he controls his dab towards short third man. Sneak a single and Root's dive saves him
lovely strike, but he can't place it properly. Finds cover as he belts this shortish ball outside off from Maxwell, who bowls around the wicket
flighted on leg stump as Root comes down on the ball with another solid sweep shot
full toss and the bat swivels in his hand as he looked to loft this over mid-on. Went off the bottom of the bat and just managed to get it over the head of Doherty who was running back
rocks back and punches the shortish ball outside off stump to cover again
that's more like it, Rooty! Tossed up on middle and he carts it over midwicket and how. Quite a way to go to your fifty
good length ball just outside off stump keeps Morgan honest
tries that dab square on on the off side but point was rushing in. Faulker kept this one back of a length outside off too
turns the shortish ball angled in at him down to long leg for an easy single
deep midwicket has a job to do and Coulter-Nile does well. Another short ball but this one is punished as Root goes back and pulls quite strongly and in front of square leg
full and just outside off as he charges down the track and drills it to mid-off
gets a thick inside edge onto the boot as Faulkner keeps it full and on the stumps
driven to mid-off as he gets right forward to the full length ball outside off
enjoys a thickish outside edge, but he was looking to find deep third man anyway. Back of a length just outside off fetches a couple as Root and Morgan hustle between the wickets
length ball, but this one is on the pads as he turns it to midwicket
another one a little too straight, but Morgan can't beat midwicket this time either
rock-solid forward defensive from Morgan as this was full and on off stump
nudges the length ball outside off between point and cover and they pick up a good single
another boundary now as Faulkner goes a touch too short and wide and Morgan cuts this away behind point
driven down towards mid-off

nearly got through and bowled Root here, this one stays a bit low and it was also too close to off to cut, which was what Root tried to do. Nearly clips his off stump but in the end they get a bye after a ricochet off the keeper

there's the wicket Australia needed! And it's Morgan, he's driven this uppishly - but not uppishly enough - to mid-off. He looked like he was trying to clear the field but it's just sailed into the hands of Watson for an easy catch
solid in defence
Bopara defends watchfully again
pushed away towards point for a single
solidly defended out to the off side
Bopara opens the face and defends to the off side
Coulter-Nile goes full and just outside off, it's driven back to him
driven down towards mid-on and he can't find the gap
Bopara gets off the mark now by opening the face and steering this down to third man
Faulkner is around the wicket and angles this in towards the off stump, which it doesn't miss by much as Bopara shoulders arms
Bopara tries another guide to third man but gets it too square
clipped away through the leg side for a single
Faulkner is over the wicket to Root, who defends back to the bowler

oh boy, now Root is gone! Does this match have a twist in the ending? Root has walked across his stumps and tried to paddle down to fine leg but he didn't get much on it and Doherty at short fine leg in the circle had no trouble taking that
driven away towards cover
worked away to leg and can't find the gap
prodded away to short midwicket
drifting in from around the wicket and Bopara drives to cover
flatter and quicker at 98kph and Bopara crunches to cover and can't find a run
again quickish at 95kph and Bopara defends
driven away to midwicket and Doherty has managed a maiden during the powerplay, super stuff from him and Clarke for bringing him on
Buttler gets off the mark with a steer behind point
driven away to cover and can't find the gap
driven on the bounce to short cover, the gaps are starting to feel non-existent to this pair it seems
pushed away to the leg side
again driven to Steve Smith at short cover on the bounce

Bopara takes a risk now and it's a biggun as he lifts Faulkner high, high out towards long-on, Watson running back from in the circle looks like he's going to make it, he has to sprint a long way back from mid-on, then at the last minute it falls just in front of him and he can only get his fingertips to it. That's a drop, albeit a very tough one to judge.
pushed away to the off side
driven down towards long-off
another push towards long-off and well run to turn this into two as Watson is a bit slow getting to the ball
bad ball and that will be a massive release for Bopara as he pulls a short one all the way to the midwicket boundary
tossed up a touch more and Bopara drives down to long-off
clipped away through midwicket and they pick up a couple
driven down to long-on for a single
punched away through cover point for another single
pushed away to midwicket
defended back towards Watson
tickled away off the pads for a single forward of square leg
angling it in towards off stump and Buttler drives it back to the bowler

sharp single here! Risky one as Bopara tucks it off his hip to midwicket and Bailey is quickly on to the ball, his throw from roughly side on just misses and lucky for Buttler it does, as he was short
driven back past the bowler

Buttler is gone now! England are digging themselves into a hole here! A shortish ball from Coulter-Nile gets Buttler's eyes lighting up and he goes for the pull, it comes out of the middle of the bat but not with enough elevation and McKay at deep midwicket takes the catch
defended back towards Coulter-Nile
Bresnan gets off the mark with a clip off his pads up in the air through midwicket
full and straight and Bopara drives to the man in the ring on the leg side
Watson goes full at the stumps, the drive can't beat mid-on
clipped away through midwicket for a single to the deep
nudged away off the pads to the leg side and can't find a gap

Bopara walks across his stumps and tickles this to short fine leg, he takes off for a quick single and Doherty inside the circle throws at the stumps at the striker's end, misses, but Bresnan was probably just home
off a leading edge now as Bresnan tries to work to leg and instead picks up a single in the air to deep point
bonus run for England now as Watson sends this one down leg for a wide
there's a much-needed boundary for England as Bopara flashes hard outside off and beats point, and the sweeper from deep cover dives in desperation but can only parry this over the boundary
goes for a drive down towards mid-on and can't find the gap
shortish ball and Bresnan swivels this pull around behind square, and they pick up a couple to Doherty, who doesn't have one of the stronger arms in this Australian team
Bresnan gives England some breathing space! He's lifted this off middle and leg and got enough bat on that to clear the boundary at wide midwicket, much-needed six that for England!
defended back towards the off side
swinging down the leg side and Bresnan picks up just the single with a clip off his legs
solid in defence
around the wicket to Bresnan, who defends
punched away to cover and can't find the gap
Faulkner runs in and delivers with an Azarenka-like grunt, and it's driven down through mid-on

Bopara works this off his hips to midwicket, Clarke's throw hits at the non-striker's end but the batsman is well home. The umpire asks for a replay, but the replay shows he was so far in he was nearly past the stumps

this time it's gone though! A run-out keeps Australia in the contest as Bresnan gets an inside edge onto his pad and out towards cover, they take off for a run but Bresnan is slow, Maxwell's throw is a direct hit at the non-striker's end and this time Bresnan is well short!
Bopara opens the face to run a single down to third man and he'll keep the strike
Bopara again glides a single down to third man - a run a ball is enough for England, as long as they don't accumulate many dots along the way
Broad almost plays on here! He tries to force a ball through off but it's very straight, this one skews away past leg stump for a single to short fine leg
another single steered to third man
Broad finds the boundary! Big shot this, he's driven it through cover and found the gap - really good placement and that gives England a little breathing space once again
tickled away off a thickish inside edge for a couple through square leg

but McKay strikes back! This match just keeps swinging from one way to another! Broad has backed off just a quarter of a step and sort of reached at a straight one, and McKay gets it through to clip the top of middle stump
driven straight back to Faulkner for no run
clipped away to midwicket and Bopara can't find the gap
again Bopara can only manage to pick out midwicket - he just can't find the gaps here
punched off the back foot down to long-on for a single
Jordan watchfully defends his first ball
clipped away off his pads out to deep square leg and there is a fumble out there from the fielder but the batsmen weren't prepared to run the second - which means Jordan has the strike
driven away to point and they get through for a quick single to get Bopara back on strike

just outside off from McKay and Bopara does what he's been doing all through his innings, steers it off the face down to third man - and in fact it's deflected off Wade's pad, which might have saved any more runs
clipped uppishly through short midwicket, just wide of the man

beaten outside off! Bopara has again just tried to tickle it away and doesn't get bat on ball. In fact there's a stumping appeal. Has Bopara lifted his foot? Oh this is close. Wade hasn't whipped the bails off, the ball has just ricocheted off him down onto the top of the bails. The third umpire is called on and this is very close. A few different replays are needed here but Bopara did lift his back foot and it was in the air when the bail was dislodged! That's out!
on the pads of Tredwell, who gets a leg bye away
all Jordan can do is get bat on ball here and works it to short midwicket
swing and a miss! Tredwell gave himself a bit of room and tried to crunch it through off but couldn't make contact
Tredwell tries to lift this over midwicket but can't connect, but they scramble through for a leg bye
good ball on the stumps and Jordan swings hard to leg, they scamper through for one run to midwicket as Clarke throws and can't hit the stumps at the non-striker's end!
edged behind and Australia have won! Oh, what a fightback from Australia, it finishes with Tredwell backing off a touch and swinging hard outside off and a thick edge has been taken by Matthew Wade.
